channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Ozempic Spells Trouble for the U.S. Economy—With 5 Exceptions
item.description: It’s not just the food industry—Ozempic and other GLP-1s are rewriting the rules of the economy. Here’s how brands can survive.

item.title: Google Just Put a Massive Crack in Apple’s Walled Garden and It’s Good News For Everyone
item.description: Google just made the Pixel 10 compatible with one of Apple’s best features–AirDrop.

item.title: Transportation chief offers advice to increasingly angry Americans: ‘Let’s maybe go back to an era where we didn’t wear our pajamas to the airport’
item.description: "Sometimes you just have to ask people, 'Hey, let's maybe go back to an era where we didn't wear our pajamas to the airport.'"

item.title: Electric Aviation Company Alleges ‘Corporate Espionage’ in Lawsuit Against Rival
item.description: Things are heating up between Joby Aviation and a competitor, Archer Aviation. Both make electric air taxis.

item.title: Trump is drafting an executive order to stop state-level AI regulation. Here’s what to know
item.description: President Donald Trump is considering pressuring states to stop regulating artificial intelligence in a draft executive order obtained Thursday by The...

item.title: Just 776 FAA employees will get Trump’s $10,000 bonus, but unions say thousands who worked during the shutdown were left out
item.description: The payments will be received no later than Dec. 9, the Federal Aviation Administration said.

item.title: The Winners (and Losers) of This New Vibe-Coding Benchmark Will Surprise You
item.description: The race for best vibe-coding AI model is neck and neck, according to Vals AI.

item.title: After calling Mamdani a ‘100% Communist lunatic,’ Trump now says ‘we’re looking for the same things’
item.description: The Republican president and new Democratic star have indicated an openness to come together for the city they've both called home.

item.title: Brazil hails ‘historic victory’ after months of pressure as Trump removes 40% tariffs on coffee imports
item.description: The President initially hiked tariffs in protest of the persecution of former President Jair Bolsonaro, who is imprisoned for attempting to stage a co...

item.title: Gen Z is ghosting dating apps: Could AI win them back?
item.description: I think back to freshman year, when my friends and I would cram onto a lumpy dorm-issue twin bed and huddle around one phone, collectively cringing as...

item.title: Eli Lilly becomes first health-care company to hit $1 trillion
item.description: Silicon Valley’s giants crowd the list of the world’s most valuable companies, but drugmaker Eli Lilly is hot on their heels. The company topped a mar...

item.title: ‘We want to trust what we’ve heard’: Farmers remain unsettled on trade, even after China’s biggest U.S. soybean purchase in two years
item.description: China’s U.S. soybean haul has exceeded 1 million metric tons this month. Trump wants China to buy 12 million tons by the end of the year.

item.title: Dan Ives Says We’re 7 Years From Peak AI—and That the iPhone Proves It
item.description: The analyst used historical examples of tech skepticism to back his perspective.

item.title: ‘Remove the Regime’: November 22 protests call for Trump impeachment in Washington, D.C. Here’s what to know
item.description: This weekend, “ Remove the Regime ” protests in the capital are demanding an end to the Trump administration’s deployment of National Guard troops in ...

item.title: Should AI moderate online hate speech?
item.description: New research has found that AI -powered content moderation systems from Google, OpenAI, Anthropic, and DeepSeek don’t always come to the same conclusi...
